text: While it's often regarded as the black sheep of the DKC trilogy, I truly have fond memories of this game. The mountains/pines/lake setting was very well realised, Rare really did a good job in trying to set it apart from the first two games. While it's hard to beat David Wise's masterpieces, I do think Eveline Fischer had a unique composition style that helped shape this game (and part of the first DKC). I still think Rockface Rumble (#532) has some of the best percussions on the SNES.
author: SupraDarky
